manuscript_citation: Wang Y, Liu Y, Fan Z, Liu D, Wang F, Zhou Y (2017) IGFBP2 enhances adipogenic differentiation potentials of mesenchymal stem cells from Wharton's jelly of the umbilical cord via JNK and Akt signaling pathways. PLoS ONE 12(8): e0184182. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0184182

authors_list.name: Yuejun Wang

components.data: Total RNA was isolated from MSCs with TRIzol Reagent (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Total RNA was isolated from MSCs with TRIzol Reagent (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA).

components.data: Reverse transcription reactions contained 2 µg RNA, random hexamers or oligo (dT), and reverse transcriptase, and were performed according to the manufacturer’s protocol (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Reverse transcription reactions contained 2 µg RNA, random hexamers or oligo (dT), and reverse transcriptase, and were performed according to the manufacturer’s protocol (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA).

components.data: Real-time PCR was performed with QuantiTect SYBR Green PCR kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) and an Icycler iQ Multi-color Real-time PCR Detection System. The reactions were run in duplicate with 1 μl of cDNA template in a 20 μl reaction volume with the program running at 95°C for 15 min, followed by 40 cycles of 94°C for 15 s,  60°C for 30 s, and 72°C for 30 s. The amplification specificity was confirmed by melting curve. The mRNA level of the target gene was acquired from the value of threshold cycle (Ct) as a relative level to that of GAPDH through the formula 2 -△Ct (△Ct = GAPDH Ct - gene of interest Ct). The efficiency of the primers was confirmed by sequencing the conventional PCR products before applying for real-time PCR.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Real-time PCR was performed with QuantiTect SYBR Green PCR kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) and an Icycler iQ Multi-color Real-time PCR Detection System. The reactions were run in duplicate with 1 μl of cDNA template in a 20 μl reaction volume with the program running at 95°C for 15 min, followed by 40 cycles of 94°C for 15 s,  60°C for 30 s, and 72°C for 30 s. The amplification specificity was confirmed by melting curve. The mRNA level of the target gene was acquired from the value of threshold cycle (Ct) as a relative level to that of GAPDH through the formula 2 -△Ct (△Ct = GAPDH Ct - gene of interest Ct). The efficiency of the primers was confirmed by sequencing the conventional PCR products before applying for real-time PCR.
